intro: Cotylanthera paucisquama, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cotylanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
